description: Human readable names for the valueset.

element.definition: Human readable names for the valueset.

element.comments: This need not be unique. However some use cases require uniqueness within a namespace and therefore best practice would be to make the name unique.
element.definition: This name is intended to be human readable, short and as specific as possible and to convey the purpose of the value set.  It is considered to be the name of the value set.
element.name: name

element.comments: There may be multiple human readable names in a given language, and this flag indicates which of them is preferred for the given language.
element.definition: Flag that this Name in this Name Language is the preferred human-readable signifier in this language.
element.name: preferred
element.short: Which name is preferred for this language

name: Alternative names

element.definition: Human readable names for the valueset.
unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

element.comments: This need not be unique. However some use cases require uniqueness within a namespace and therefore best practice would be to make the name unique.
element.definition: This name is intended to be human readable, short and as specific as possible and to convey the purpose of the value set.  It is considered to be the name of the value set.
element.name: name

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

element.comments: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition should be version specific.  This will ideally be the URI for the Resource Profile defining the extension, with the code for the extension after a #.
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension

element.definition: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).

element.comments: There may be multiple human readable names in a given language, and this flag indicates which of them is preferred for the given language.
element.definition: Flag that this Name in this Name Language is the preferred human-readable signifier in this language.
element.name: preferred
element.short: Which name is preferred for this language
